thread.title: Fitness is life for these sibling co-owners of Paradigm Gym
thread.title_full: Fitness is life for these sibling co-owners of Paradigm Gym

author: Leslie Barker
title: Fitness is life for these sibling co-owners of Paradigm Gym
text:
Get Unlimited Digital Access Your first month is less than a dollar. $0.99 for first 4 weeks Subscribe Now 
Brian Casad, 33, and his kid sister Kelli, 30, grew up participating in sports. Then came college. Kelli gained close to 80 pounds; Brian's football, wrestling and weightlifting went by the wayside, as did any semblance of healthy eating. 
Kelly: "Once I graduated from college, I started exercising excessively and starving myself. Being that I was an extremely picky eater, eating healthy was out of the question. I tried fat burners, diet pills and skipped meals. The weight came off -- and fast. The problem was, I couldn't maintain the weight loss over a long period of time. I yoyo-ed." 
Brian: "Three or four years after college, I found I hated my career path [real estate tax consulting] and chose to channel my frustrations through igniting my passion for fitness again, and by transitioning into a healthier lifestyle. Five years ago, I quit my job and bought into a gym franchise [Title Boxing Club]." 
Business expanded and he added another gym, Paradigm. 
Kelli, meanwhile, had upped her protein and vegetable intake, reduced carbohydrates and limited her sugar and alcohol consumption. She began lifting weights and including boxing and kickboxing into her workout. 
In 2012, Brian asked her to be assistant manager at his gym; in 2013, to be a partner. Paradigm Gym owner Brian Casad, right, works out on a Matrix machine while his sister, co-owner and general manager Kelli Casad, watches during a recent workout. Ashley Landis/Staff Photographer 
"This is a family business over all," Brian says. "Our brother and parents have some ownership as well." KELLI CASAD: Typical week of workouts: 
I work out five to six days a week, which varies on how my body feels. Usually, I'll do two to three days of boxing/kickboxing, and two to three days of lifting weights. Paradigm Gym co-owner and general manager Kelli Casad pushes a sled during her workout. She owns the gym with her brother, Brian Casad. Ashley Landis/Staff Photographer Proudest fitness moment: 
Getting my body fat percentage to 16 and finding the courage to post a transformation photo on my social media. What gets in the way of my routine? 
I try to prioritize my workouts, so the only time I allow my routine to slip is when my body needs rest due to injury or illness. Three things you'll always find in my refrigerator: 
Chicken, salmon, asparagus
